intro: Astragalus hebecarpus, commonly known as the narrowpod milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its seed pods are slender and curved, containing small, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind. Astragalus hebecarpus plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
